hero.title: Systems that outlast trends.
hero.description: Most web projects are built to launch. We build to last. The difference isn't in the framework—it's in the questions asked before the first commit.

1.common: Build the features users asked for
1.alpha: Understand what problem users are trying to solve

2.alpha: Define constraints before opening the editor

3.alpha: Launch is when the system starts working, not when work starts

data.title: Data First
data.description: Before UI. Before features. Before branding. We map what the system needs to know. Bad data models can't be fixed with good code.

scale.title: Scale Assumptions
scale.description: We design for 10x before you need it. Not because you'll get there—but because assumptions about growth change every technical decision.

maintenance.title: Maintenance Cost
maintenance.description: A system that requires constant intervention isn't finished. We optimize for long stretches of silence—where nothing breaks, nothing drifts.

handoff.title: Team Handoff
handoff.description: Code written for one person is fragile. Every commit assumes someone else will need to understand it in six months.

constraints.title: Constraints are design tools.
constraints.paragraphs:
Unlimited options paralyze. We start every project by defining what we won't build. What features won't exist. What use cases won't be supported. What browsers won't be accommodated.

This isn't limitation—it's focus. A system designed for everyone serves no one well.

Constraints force decisions. Decisions create character. Character builds identity.

bilingual.title: Structure that respects direction.
bilingual.paragraphs:
Most sites treat RTL as an afterthought—flipping layouts and hoping it works. We design systems where direction is a first-class citizen.

Because this isn't about translation. It's about cultural adaptation. About understanding that right-aligned navigation isn't just mirrored—it's reconsidered.

Every component. Every layout. Every interaction. Built to work in both directions without compromise.

items.3: Work with agencies positioning themselves between us and the end client
items.5: Start work before the problem is understood

caseStudy.title: Art Lighting Store
caseStudy.subtitle: High-resolution product imagery at scale. Real-time inventory. Zero-compromise load times.

problem.title: The Problem
problem.description:
The client sold premium lighting fixtures—products where detail matters. Existing platforms compressed images to the point of uselessness. Customers couldn't see finishes, textures, or scale.

Simultaneously, inventory was managed across three systems: physical warehouse, Shopify, and a custom ERP. Updates took hours. Overselling was frequent.

They needed a system that felt expensive, loaded instantly, and stayed in sync.

decision1.title: Image Optimization Without Quality Loss
decision1.description: Standard e-commerce platforms serve one image size to all devices. We built a dynamic image pipeline that generates optimal sizes on-demand and caches aggressively.

decision2.title: Real-Time Inventory Sync
decision2.description: We built a webhook-based inventory system that updates across all platforms within 30 seconds. Overselling became impossible.

decision3.title: Performance Under Load
decision3.description: During peak shopping periods, the site needed to handle 10x normal traffic without degradation. We used edge caching, static generation, and database read replicas.

architecture.title: System Architecture
architecture.description: The system is built as a modular monolith: single deployment, clear boundaries. Each domain (products, orders, inventory) is isolated but shares infrastructure.
architecture.structure:
apps/
├── web/           # Customer-facing store
├── admin/         # Inventory management
└── api/           # Shared API layer

packages/
├── database/      # Prisma schema + migrations
├── images/        # Image optimization pipeline
├── inventory/     # Real-time sync logic
└── payments/      # Stripe integration

infra/
├── cdn/           # Cloudflare edge config
├── database/      # PostgreSQL + read replicas
└── storage/       # R2 for images

results.title: Results
results.description:
The system launched on schedule. Within the first month:

Conversion rate increased 34% (better product imagery made the difference). Page load times dropped from 6.2s to 1.2s. Customer complaints about "site feels slow" disappeared.

Most importantly: the client's team can now manage inventory without technical intervention. The system runs itself.

hero.title: What quality means to us.
hero.description: Standards aren't suggestions. They're the baseline for every line of code we write.

code.title: Code Standards
code.description: Code is read more than it's written. We optimize for clarity, not cleverness.
code.requirements: TypeScript strict mode enforced | ESLint + Prettier with zero warnings | 100% type coverage on public APIs | Meaningful variable names (no abbreviations) | Functions under 50 lines | Components under 200 lines
code.benchmarks: Max cyclomatic complexity: 10 | Test coverage: 80% minimum | Documentation: Every public function | Code review: Required before merge

performance.title: Performance Benchmarks
performance.description: Fast isn't a feature—it's a requirement. We measure, optimize, and maintain performance as a core deliverable.
performance.requirements: Lighthouse Performance score > 90 | First Contentful Paint < 1.5s | Time to Interactive < 3.5s | Cumulative Layout Shift < 0.1 | Total Blocking Time < 300ms
performance.benchmarks: Initial bundle size: < 200KB gzipped | Image optimization: WebP with fallbacks | Code splitting: Route-based minimum | Caching strategy: Documented and tested

accessibility.title: Accessibility Requirements
accessibility.description: Accessible design isn't optional. Every interface must work for everyone.
accessibility.requirements: WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance | Keyboard navigation: Complete | Screen reader testing: NVDA + VoiceOver | Color contrast: 4.5:1 minimum | Focus indicators: Visible on all interactive elements | ARIA labels: Semantic and accurate
accessibility.benchmarks: Axe DevTools: Zero violations | Lighthouse Accessibility: > 95 | Manual testing: Required for complex interactions

security.title: Security Protocols
security.description: Security is built in, not bolted on. We follow industry best practices and go beyond when necessary.
security.requirements: Dependencies: Automated vulnerability scanning | Authentication: Industry-standard (OAuth, JWT) | Input validation: Server and client | SQL injection: Parameterized queries only | XSS protection: Content Security Policy | HTTPS: Enforced everywhere
security.benchmarks: Security headers: A+ rating (securityheaders.com) | Dependency updates: Weekly automated | Penetration testing: Before major launches | Secrets management: Never in code

enforcement.title: How we enforce this.
enforcement.description: Standards mean nothing without enforcement. Every pull request is checked automatically. Code that doesn't meet standards doesn't merge. No exceptions.
